docs.title: Home
docs.text:
Version

version is a small cli tool that bumps your version number for you and retrieves the latest version of a specified datasource.

docs.title: Supported versioning schemes
docs.text: Currently, version only supports SemVer 2.0. SemVer 2.0 is one of the most used versioning schemes.

docs.title: Supported datasources
docs.text: Currently, version only supports Docker registries as a datasource. At the moment version doesn't support authentication, but other than that if the docker-cli pulls it, version supports it. This means that among others, ghcr.io hub.docker.com, gcr.io, and docker.pkg.dev are supported.

docs.title: GitHub Action
docs.text: version can be used in GitHub Actions to bump version numbers or retrieve the latest version of a dependency.

docs.title: Usage
docs.text:
steps:
  - name: Bump version
    id: bump
    uses: version-cli/action@v0.2.0
    with:
      command: bump
      args: 1.2.3 --minor

docs.title: Inputs
docs.text: Input Description Required Default command Command to run (bump or latest) Yes args Arguments to pass to the command Yes

docs.title: Outputs
docs.text: Output Description version The output of the command

docs.title: Bump version
docs.text:
steps:
  - name: Bump version
    id: bump
    uses: version-cli/action@v0.2.0
    with:
      command: bump
      args: 1.2.3 --minor
  - name: Print version
    run: echo ${{ steps.bump.outputs.version }}
    # Output: 1.3.0

docs.title: Retrieve latest version
docs.text:
steps:
  - name: Retrieve latest version
    id: latest
    uses: version-cli/action@v0.2.0
    with:
      command: latest
      args: --datasource docker ghcr.io/version-cli/version
  - name: Print version
    run: echo ${{ steps.latest.outputs.version }}
    # Output: 0.1.3

docs.title: Update workflow with latest versions
docs.text:
This example shows how to use version in a GitHub Action to automatically update a workflow file with the latest 3 versions of a Docker image (in this case, kindest/node). This is useful for matrix builds where you want to test against the latest versions of a dependency.

name: Update Kindest Node Versions

on:
  schedule:
    - cron: '0 0 * * 0' # Run weekly
  workflow_dispatch:

jobs:
  update-versions:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    steps:
      - name: Checkout
        uses: actions/checkout@v6

      - name: Get latest versions
        id: versions
        uses: version-cli/action@<version>
        with:
          command: latest
          args: --datasource docker --count 3 kindest/node

      - name: Update workflow
        run: |
          # Convert newlines to JSON array
          VERSIONS_JSON=$(echo "${{ steps.versions.outputs.version }}" | jq -R -s -c 'split("\n")[:-1]')

          # Update the target workflow file using yq
          yq -i ".jobs.test.strategy.matrix.k8s-version = $VERSIONS_JSON" .github/workflows/test.yaml

      - name: Create Pull Request
        uses: peter-evans/create-pull-request@v6
        with:
          title: "ci: update kindest/node versions"
          body: "Updates the kindest/node versions in the test workflow to the latest 3 versions."
          branch: "update-kindest-node-versions"

docs.title: Homebrew
docs.text:
brew tap version-cli/version
brew install version

docs.title: Docker
docs.text:
You can run version using Docker:

docker run ghcr.io/version-cli/version:latest ...

docs.title: Go
docs.text:
If you have Go 1.24+ installed, you can install version using go install:

go install github.com/version-cli/version@latest

docs.title: Manual
docs.text: You can download the pre-compiled binaries from the releases page and copy them to a location in your $PATH.

docs.title: Shell Completion
docs.text: version provides completion scripts for Bash, Zsh, Fish, and PowerShell.

docs.title: Bash
docs.text: To load completions for every new session, execute once:

docs.title: Linux
docs.text: version completion bash > /etc/bash_completion.d/version

docs.title: macOS
docs.text: version completion bash > $(brew --prefix)/etc/bash_completion.d/version

docs.title: Zsh
docs.text:
If shell completion is not already enabled in your environment, you will need to enable it. You can execute the following once:

echo "autoload -U compinit; compinit" >> ~/.zshrc

To load completions for each session, execute once:

version completion zsh > "${fpath[1]}/_version"

You will need to start a new shell for this setup to take effect.

docs.title: Fish
docs.text:
To load completions for each session, execute once:

version completion fish > ~/.config/fish/completions/version.fish

docs.title: PowerShell
docs.text:
To load completions in your current shell session:

goreleaser completion powershell | Out-String | Invoke-Expression

To load completions for every new session, add the output of the above command to your powershell profile.

docs.title: Bump
docs.text: version can bump version numbers for you.

docs.title: Usage
docs.text: version bump [flags] VERSION

docs.title: Aliases
docs.text:
You can also use next as an alias for bump.

version next [flags] VERSION

docs.title: Flags
docs.text: Flag Shorthand Description Default --major -M Set version level to major false --minor -m Set version level to minor false --patch -p Set version level to patch true --count -c Number of versions to bump 1 --semver -S Use semver as the versioning type true

docs.title: Bump patch version
docs.text:
version bump 1.2.3
# Output: 1.2.4

docs.title: Bump minor version
docs.text:
version bump --minor 1.2.3
# Output: 1.3.0

docs.title: Bump major version
docs.text:
version bump --major 1.2.3
# Output: 2.0.0

docs.title: Bump multiple versions
docs.text:
version bump --count 2 1.2.3
# Output: 1.2.5

docs.title: Retrieve Latest Versions
docs.text: version can retrieve the latest version of a dependency from a datasource.

docs.title: Usage
docs.text: version latest [flags] DEPNAME

docs.title: Flags
docs.text: Flag Shorthand Description Required Default --datasource -d Datasource to use Yes --major -M Set version level to major No false --minor -m Set version level to minor No false --patch -p Set version level to patch No true --count -c Number of versions to retrieve No 1 --semver -S Use semver as the versioning type No true

docs.title: Retrieve latest version
docs.text:
version latest --datasource docker ghcr.io/version-cli/version
# Output: 0.1.3

docs.title: Retrieve latest 3 versions
docs.text:
version latest --datasource docker --count 3 ghcr.io/version-cli/version
# Output:
# 0.1.1
# 0.1.2
# 0.1.3

docs.title: Retrieve latest minor version
docs.text:
version latest --datasource docker --minor ghcr.io/version-cli/version
# Output: 0.1.3

docs.title: Retrieve latest major version
docs.text:
version latest --datasource docker --major ghcr.io/version-cli/version
# Output: 0.1.3
